name: Macanudo - Inspirado - Palladium - Robusto
additionalNotes:
Macanudo cigars were first developed under the creative leadership of Ramon Cifuentes in 1971. Its origins started off as a Jamaican brand by the makers of Cuban Punch and branched off as its own. Today, it is produced and manufactured by General Cigar Company in the Dominican Republic. These premium 
Macanudo cigars are the best-selling brand in America. Macanudo cigars always provide a consistent smoke, giving you smooth delicious flavor every time. Since the late 1960's, Macanudo cigars have worked hard to be a great cigar that any palate can enjoy and appreciate. Every cigar made by Macanudo today follows the same journey that the original sticks did as the company While the company itself has roots dating back to the late 1960's Macanudo cigars weren't sold in the United States until the early 70's. In 1971, the General Cigar Company purchased the rights to the Macanudo name from the Cuban brand, Punch. At the time, Macanudo cigars were produced in Jamaica, However, in 2000, General Cigar moved production of the cigars to the Dominican Republic. That facility is located in Santiago, in the north-central part of the country.
